items.name: ACTARA
items.description:
ACTARA gives quick knock-down of aphids as well as giving persistent control. ACTARA is systemic and will move into new growth to provide long-lasting control.

ACTARA contains thiamethoxam for the control of aphids in potatoes and the reduction of virus diseases associated with aphid vectors.

Mixing and spraying: add ACTARA to the spray tank first, followed by any additional products. Apply ACTARA either as a foliar spray in 200-400 l/ha water or through specialist in-furrow equipment using 50-150 l/ha water.

Water volume: 200-400 l/ha as a foliar spray or 50-150 l/ha in-furrow.

Rainfastness: 1 hour
items.label: https://www.syngenta.co.uk/file/7396/download?token=xpHVzKOW

items.name: Adigor
items.description:
ADIGOR is a methylated rapeseed oil-based adjuvant, it is for use with all authorized plant protection products in cereals.

composition: 47% w/w methylated rapeseed oil

Crops:  Cereals

pesticides: all authorized plant protection products

Maximum individual dose: 1% concentration of spray volume

Maximum number of treatments: Follow the statutory conditions of use of the plant protection product

Dose: Apply ADIGOR up to a maximum of 1% concentration of the total spray volume.

Mixing Procedure: Make sure the sprayer is set to give an even application at the correct volume. Fill the spray tank with half the required volume of water and begin agitation. Add and disperse the herbicide product first, then add the required amount of ADIGOR. Add the rest of the water and continue to agitate the mixture thoroughly. Always agitate during spraying.
items.label: https://www.syngenta.co.uk/file/7426/download?token=YPBDoyjK

items.name: ALTO ELITE
items.description:
For the control of a wide range of diseases on winter wheat,

winter barley, spring barley, winter field beans, spring field

beans and combining peas.

Suspension concentrate containing 40 g/l (3.4% w/w)

cyproconazole and 375 g/l (31.3% w/w) chlorothalonil.

Rates of Use: Apply ALTO ELITE at 2 litres/ha. A maximum total dose of 4.0 litres/ha ALTO ELITE can be applied to crops of winter wheat, winter and spring barley, winter and spring field beans and combining peas.
items.label: https://www.syngenta.co.uk/file/7441/download?token=oJg2Pbmc

items.name: AXIAL
items.description:
Controls wild oats and ryegrasses in winter and spring wheat and winter and spring barley. Controls blackgrass in winter and spring barley as part of an integrated control strategy.

Emulsifiable concentrate containing 100 g/l (9.8 % w/w) pinoxaden and 25 g/l (2.45 % w/w) cloquintocet-mexyl.

CROP SPECIFIC INFORMATION

Crops

AXIAL can be used on all varieties of winter and spring wheat and winter and spring barley.

Timing

Spray in the autumn, winter or spring from two true leaves (GS12) to before flag leaf sheath extending

stage of the crop. Spraying should be done when the majority of weeds have germinated, but before

weed competition reduces yield.

Rates of use

Apply AXIAL at 0.3-0.6 litres per hectare, always in mixture with ADIGOR adjuvant. The dose rate of

AXIAL depends on target grass species and season.

Winter and spring wheat and winter and spring barley

Wild oats – apply 0.3 litres per hectare AXIAL from 1st leaf unfolded to flag leaf ligule visible.

Italian rye-grass and perennial rye-grass (from seed) – apply 0.45 litres per hectare AXIAL from 1st leaf

unfolded to flag leaf ligule visible. Where applications are made to rye-grasses no larger than the 2 tiller

stage (GS22) a dose of 0.3 litres per hectare may give acceptable levels of control. Always use as part

of a weed control programme including other products active against ryegrasses.
items.label: https://www.syngenta.co.uk/file/7596/download?token=xe5A93Gs

items.name: Beret Gold
items.description:
Flowable concentrate for seed treatment containing 25 g/l (2.43% w/w) fludioxonil Controls seed-borne diseases on winter and spring crops of wheat, barley, oats, rye and triticale and also soil-borne bunt.

Rates of Use : 2.0 litres BERET GOLD per tonne of seed

APPLICATION: BERET GOLD should be applied directly to the seed using conventional seed treatment equipment. Continuous flow treaters should be calibrated using BERET GOLD before use. Do not apply BERET GOLD to cracked, split or sprouted seed.
items.label: https://www.syngenta.co.uk/file/7616/download?token=DPdEfi7T
